1.text: Wisdom has built her house; she has carved out her seven pillars.

2.text: She has prepared her meat and mixed her wine; she has also set her table.

3.text: She has sent out her maidservants; she calls out from the heights of the city.

4.text: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” she says to him who lacks judgment.

5.text: “Come, eat my bread and drink the wine I have mixed.

6.text: Leave your folly behind, and you will live; walk in the way of understanding.”

7.text: He who corrects a mocker brings shame on himself; he who rebukes a wicked man taints himself.

8.text: Do not rebuke a mocker, or he will hate you; rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.

9.text: Instruct a wise man, and he will be wiser still; teach a righteous man, and he will increase his learning.

10.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

11.text: For through wisdom your days will be multiplied, and years will be added to your life.

12.text: If you are wise, you are wise to your own advantage; but if you scoff, you alone will bear the consequences.

13.text: The woman named Folly is loud; she is naive and knows nothing.

14.text: She sits at the door of her house, on a seat in the heights of the city,

15.text: calling out to those who pass by, who make their paths straight.

16.text: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” she says to him who lacks judgment.

17.text: “Stolen water is sweet, and bread eaten in secret is tasty!”

18.text: But they do not know that the dead are there, that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
